headline: Honeywell, Flexjet settle litigation, extend engine maintenance deal
summary: Honeywell said on Wednesday it had reached ​an agreement with private aviation ‌company Flexjet to resolve their litigation and ‌aims to rebuild their commercial partnership.  The industrial conglomerate said it agreed to extend its aircraft engine ⁠maintenance deal ‌with Flexjet through 2035 as part of the settlement.  Flexjet ‍had sued Honeywell in March 2023, accusing the company of breaching an aircraft ​engine maintenance services deal and ‌seeking liquidated damages over delayed engine repairs.

raw.headline: Honeywell, Flexjet settle litigation, extend engine maintenance deal

The industrial conglomerate said it agreed to extend its aircraft engine ⁠maintenance deal ‌with Flexjet through 2035 as part of the settlement.  Flexjet ‍had sued Honeywell in March 2023, accusing the company of breaching an aircraft ​engine maintenance services deal and ‌seeking liquidated damages over delayed engine repairs.

headline: Honeywell Settles Litigation With Flexjet. What It Means for the Stock.
summary: Honeywell  has finally put one pandemic-related issue in the rearview mirror.  Flexjet had alleged that Honeywell failed live up to repair contracts, while Honeywell contended that supply-chain problems made that difficult during the Covid-19 pandemic.  In December, Honeywell announced it would take a fourth-quarter charge of $470 million related to the Flexjet litigation.

headline: Honeywell CEO: Why “Physical AI” Won’t Replace All Industrial Jobs—and What It Will Change
summary: Vimal Kapur, Honeywell CEO, speaks with WSJ Leadership Institute President Alan Murray on how AI is moving from digital tools to physical infrastructure. Kapur explains how Honeywell is using “physical AI” to help factories, refineries, and other businesses operate amid shortages in skilled employees—augmenting workers rather than fully replacing them.

headline: HONEYWELL AND FLEXJET FINALIZE SETTLEMENT, RENEW LONG-TERM CONTRACT THROUGH 2035
summary: Honeywell (Nasdaq: HON) and Flexjet are pleased to have reached a comprehensive agreement to resolve their pending litigation and look forward to rebuilding the parties' commercial partnership.

headline: Honeywell CEO: Splitting into 3 separate companies positions us well for the next couple of decades
summary: Honeywell CEO Vimal Kapur joins 'Squawk Box' to discuss the split into three separate, publicly traded companies, state of the industrial sector, and more.
